NEW YORK
WORLD’S FAIR 1939
39-N 11 a
CITY OF NEW YORK
MUNICIPAL BROADCASTING SYSTEM
MUNICIPAL BUILDING
WORTH 2-5600
September 19, 1939
Mr. Frank E. Schooley, Ex. Sec’ty.
The Nat1!. Assn, of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
Urbana, Ill.
My dear Franks
I have been away from the office or else I would
have written sooner to thank you for your promptness
in getting the telegram to the Mayor and for the
execution of the motion in sending the resolution
to the Mayor.
I will attempt to contact Mr. Early today or tomorrow.
|Mr. Joseph Weber, 1450 Broadway, Mew York City, is
President of the Musicians Union. I had a chance to
I chat with Howard Evans the other day and acquainted
him with our formal decision to have him sit in as a
special representative of the HAEB. Will follow
through your idea of writing to the President about
your attendance at the Washington hearing on October 16th.
(That is, if I am able to raise the money for your
expenses.)
WhatTs happened to the statement of aims and purposes?
Is it available for publication in our next Masterwork
Bulletin? I would also appreciate a list of the officers
and members of the Executive Committee.
M.S.N.
“New York City's Own Station”—810 Kc.
